text:
I want to move all files which doesn't exists in the destination dir from C:\src
to C:\dest.
Therefor I wrote this ant target:

-----
<target name="test">
	<move todir="C:/dest">
		<fileset dir="C:/src">
			<include name="*"/>
		</fileset>
		<fileset dir="C:/dest">
			<exclude name="*"/>
		</fileset>
	</move>
</target>
------

But all files got overwritted.

I tried the same with the copy task.

------
<target name="test">
	<copy todir="C:/dest">
		<fileset dir="C:/src">
			<include name="*"/>
		</fileset>
		<fileset dir="C:/dest">
			<exclude name="*"/>
		</fileset>
	</copy>
</target>
-------

Only those files that doesn't allready extist got copied to the destination dir.



I think this two tasks should both whether dont't overwrite the existing file or
not.

Best regards.
creator: meinDummy@googlemail.com
antoine@apache.org
text:
Hi,

this is not a bug.

Please look at the Concept and Types section of the manual, and particularly the
selectors page.

What you want to do can be done with the present selector.

Closing as Invalid.

This type of questions is better served on the user mailing list (user at ant
dot apache dot org).

Antoine
